questions.question: What is Cloud Computing?
questions.answer: Model for enabling ubiquitous, convenient, on-demand network access to a shared pool of configurable computing resources that can be rapidly provisioned and released with minimal management effort or service provider intervention

questions.question: What is Cloud Computing is composed of?
questions.answer: 5 essential characteristics, 3 service models, 4 deployment models

questions.question: Which are the 5 essential Cloud Computing characteristics?
questions.answer: 1. On-demand self-service; 2. Broad network access; 3. Resource pooling; 4. Rapid elasticity; 5. Measured service

questions.question: What is On-demand self-service cloud computing characteristic about?
questions.answer: A consumer can unilaterally provision computing capabilities as needed without requiring human intervention with each service provider

questions.question: What is Broad network access cloud computing characteristic about?
questions.answer: Capabilities are available over the network and accessed through standard mechanism that promote use on any device

questions.question: What is Resource pooling cloud computing characteristic about?
questions.answer: Provider's computing resources are pooled to serve multiple consumers using a multi-tenant model

questions.question: What is Rapid elasticity cloud computing characteristic about?
questions.answer: Capabilities can be elastically provisioned and released, in some cases, automatically, to scale rapidly outward and inward

questions.question: What is Measured service cloud computing characteristic about?
questions.answer: Resource usage can be monitored, controlled, and reported, providing transparency for both the provider and consumer of the utilized service

questions.question: Which are the 3 Cloud Service models?
questions.answer: 1. Software as a Service (SaaS); 2. Platform as a Service (PaaS); 3. Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)

questions.question: What is Software as a service service model about?
questions.answer: Provide applications to users

questions.question: What is Platform as a service service model about?
questions.answer: Provide specialized software components and programming tools for developers

questions.question: What is Infrastructure as a service service model about?
questions.answer: Provide computing infrastructure resource as a service to administrators

questions.question: Which are the 4 Cloud Deployment models?
questions.answer: 1. Private; 2. Hybrid; 3. Community; 4. Public

questions.question: What is private cloud deployment model about?
questions.answer: You run everything in your own data center

questions.question: What is hybrid cloud deployment model about?
questions.answer: Combine two or more of the deployment models

questions.question: What is community cloud deployment model about?
questions.answer: Shared deployment between organizations

questions.question: What is public cloud deployment model about?
questions.answer: You run all your services in public clouds

questions.question: Which are the effects of moving from on-premises to cloud computing?
questions.answer: 1. Localization of cost; 2. Material spend; 3. Variable price

questions.question: What is localization of cost regards the effect of moving from on-premise to cloud?
questions.answer: Cost are not managed by a central entity but by developer's hands

questions.question: What is material spend regards the effect of moving from on-premise to cloud?
questions.answer: Not possibility to predict the exact cost of the infrastructure

questions.question: What is variable cost regards the effect of moving from on-premise to cloud?
questions.answer: Spend what you use

questions.question: What is FinOps?
questions.answer: The practice of bringing financial accountability to the variable spend model of cloud, enabling teams to make business tradeoffs between spend, cost and quality

questions.question: What is FinOps about?
questions.answer: 1. An effective approach for teams to manage their cloud costs; 2. Ownership driven and supported by a central group; 3. Work towards financial and operational control; 4. A way to prioritize ongoing optimization of your cloud costs

questions.question: Why use a FinOps approach?
questions.answer: 1. Cloud spending increases year over year; 2. Managing cloud spending can be overwhelming without a culture shift; 3. Set of best practices; 4. Provide component oversight of cloud spending

questions.question: Which are the principles of FinOps?
questions.answer: 1. Collaboration; 2. Business value; 3. Ownership; 4. Timely reports; 5. Centralized team; 6. Variable cost model

questions.question: What is Collaboration principle about?
questions.answer: FinOps is not about one person at a company but a constant collaboration between different people within the organization

questions.question: What is Business value principle about?
questions.answer: FinOps needs to be implemented to provide value for the organization. Provide for cost optimization and a solid ROI

questions.question: What is Ownership principle about?
questions.answer: Stakeholders need to be able to control and take ownership of their expenses

questions.question: What is Timely reports principle about?
questions.answer: Reports should be routine and concise to provide insight into cloud spending and forecasting

questions.question: What is Centralized team principle about?
questions.answer: A FinOps Team should be centralized to provide for an enterprise focused approach removing redundancy but provide for collaboration

questions.question: What is Variable Cost Model principle about?
questions.answer: Cloud spending is variable and therefore the FinOps team must have processes, practices and tools in place to manage and monitor spending to meet business goals

questions.question: Which are the phases of FinOps lifecycle?
questions.answer: 1. Inform; 2. Optimize; 3. Operate

questions.question: Which are the phases of FinOps lifecycle?
questions.answer: 1. Inform; 2. Optimize; 3. Operate

questions.question: What is Inform phase about?
questions.answer: Understanding your organizations resources comsumption through context, data, budgets and forecasting

questions.question: Which are the main tasks/goals of Inform phase?
questions.answer: 1. Create tags/labels; 2. Setup account hierarchy; 3. Goal is for near real-time visibility

questions.question: Which are the principles supported by the Inform phase?
questions.answer: Set goals

questions.question: What is Optimize phase about?
questions.answer: Setting your goals and targets by determining your cloud cost through strategy, tracking, cost breakdown and cost growth boundary

questions.question: Which are the main tasks/goals of Optimize phase?
questions.answer: 1. Set the goals and determine impact; 2. Achieve the goals

questions.question: Which are the principles supported by the Inform phase?
questions.answer: 1. Principle 1: Teams need to collaborate; 2. Principle 2: Business value of cloud drives decisions; 3. Principle 6: Take advantages of the variable cost model of the cloud

questions.question: What is Operate phase about?
questions.answer: Aligning organization teams to business goals through drive and action

questions.question: Which are the main tasks/goals of Optimize phase?
questions.answer: 1. Target, define, and document optimization opportunities; 2. Automation

questions.question: Which are the principles supported by the Inform phase?
questions.answer: 1. Principle 2: Business value of cloud drives decision; 2. Principle 5: A centralized teams drives FinOps; 3. Principle 6: Take advantages of the variable cost model of the cloud

questions.question: What is CAPEX?
questions.answer: Capex (Capital Expenditures) are investments made by an organization for long-term benefits in the future

questions.question: What change does it means to migrate to the cloud regards cost?
questions.answer: Shift from CAPEX to OPEX financing and payment models

questions.question: What is ROI?
questions.answer: Return on Investment (ROI) is the proportionate increase in the value of an investment over a period

questions.question: How is profit calculated?
questions.answer: Profit is equal to the income minus the costs

questions.question: How is ROI calculated?
questions.answer: ROI is equal to Profit divided by costs

questions.question: What is TCO?
questions.answer: Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) is the total cost associated with data center deployment

questions.question: What is the goal regards TCO and ROI?
questions.answer: Obtaining a solid ROI while minimizing TCO

questions.question: What is chargeback?
questions.answer: Policy of allocating resource usage costs to actual business units

questions.question: What is the characteristics of chargeback?
questions.answer: 1. Accounting model; 2. zeroed out; see costs

questions.question: What is the accounting model characteristic of chargeback?
questions.answer: Individual cost centers are charged for their IT service based on use and activity

questions.question: What is zeroed out characteristic of chargeback?
questions.answer: All IT costs are assigned to users/business units

questions.question: What is see costs characteristic of chargeback?
questions.answer: Allow users/business units to see their costs and understand how those costs are determined

questions.question: Which are some of the optimization challenges with DevOps?
questions.answer: 1. DevOps consumes resources faster and unpredictably; 2. Cost is not always a concern with DevOps engineers; 3. Hard coded resources (IaC); 4. App owner resistance; 5. Traditional FinOps allocation doesn't work; 6. Multiple container/apps
